title: Antares new features v8.6.0
code: dir_path <- tempdir() createStudy(path = dir_path,              study_name = "test860",              antares_version = "8.6.0") #> Warning: Parameter 'horizon' is missing or inconsistent with 'january.1st' and 'leapyear'. Assume correct year is 2018. #> To avoid this warning message in future simulations, open the study with Antares and go to the simulation tab, put a valid year number in the cell 'horizon' and use consistent values for parameters 'Leap year' and '1st january'.

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
code: createArea(name = "fr") createArea(name = "it")

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
text: can create new st-storage cluster new function createClusterST(). can see function documentation ?createClusterST. default can call function two parameters (area, cluster_name). Now can see informations simulation options.
code: inflows_data <- matrix(3, 8760) ratio_values <- matrix(0.7, 8760)  createClusterST(area = "fr",                  cluster_name = "test_storage",                  storage_parameters = storage_values_default(),                  PMAX_injection = ratio_values,                  PMAX_withdrawal = ratio_values,                  inflows = inflows_data,                  lower_rule_curve = ratio_values,                  upper_rule_curve = ratio_values,                  overwrite = TRUE)  createClusterST(area = "it",                  cluster_name = "test_storage",                  storage_parameters = storage_values_default(),                  PMAX_injection = ratio_values,                  PMAX_withdrawal = ratio_values,                  inflows = inflows_data,                  lower_rule_curve = ratio_values,                  upper_rule_curve = ratio_values,                  overwrite = TRUE) opts <- simOptions() opts$areasWithSTClusters #> [1] "fr" "it"

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
text: creating “st-storage” clusters, can read information specific function readClusterSTDesc().
code: tab <- readClusterSTDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(tab)

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
text: St-storages data time series can read areas specific area. 5 files contening one time series generated (one per function parameter): PMAX-injection.txt PMAX-withdrawal.txt inflows.txt lower-rule-curve.txt upper-rule-curve.txt can see, last two columns (st-storage, name_file) give value name file.FYI : default, reading option hourly timestep 8736 (see opts$timeIdMax).

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
text: possible edit parameters values data values like want.
code: # edit parameters values  list_params_st <- storage_values_default() list_params_st$efficiency <- 0.5 list_params_st$reservoircapacity <- 50  # edit data values inflows_data <- matrix(4, 8760)  editClusterST(area = "fr",                cluster_name = "test_storage",                storage_parameters = list_params_st,               inflows = inflows_data,               add_prefix = TRUE)  # read parameters tab <- readClusterSTDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(tab) # read data data_st_storage <- readInputTS(st_storage = "all") #> Importing st-storage #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |===================================                                   |  50%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% rmarkdown::paged_table(head(data_st_storage))

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
text: Creating editing st-storage done, can also remove clusters study. area fr deleted cause created one cluster test_storage. Parameters data concerning cluster area removed.
code: # remove cluster removeClusterST(area = "fr",                  cluster_name = "test_storage",                  add_prefix = TRUE)  # delete control  opts <- simOptions() opts$areasWithSTClusters #> [1] "it" # control removed parameters tab <- readClusterSTDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(head(tab)) # control removed data data_st_storage <- readInputTS(st_storage = "all") #> Importing st-storage #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% rmarkdown::paged_table(head(data_st_storage)) unique(data_st_storage$area) #> [1] "it"

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
text: Antares version 8.6.0 now provide pollutants parameters thermal clusters. can see documentation thermal clusters . global list pollutants given function list_pollutants_values(). default, parameters set NULL, can initialize parameters value customize parameters. Let’s see edit 3 parameters nh3, nox, pm2_5.
code: # create cluster with pollutants  # pollutants all_param_pollutants <- list_pollutants_values(multi_values = 0.25)  createCluster(area = "fr",                cluster_name = "test_pollutant",                unitcount = 1L,                marginal_cost = 50,               list_pollutants = all_param_pollutants,                time_series = matrix(rep(c(0, 8000), each = 24*364), ncol = 2),               prepro_modulation = matrix(rep(c(1, 1, 1, 0), each = 24*365), ncol = 4)                ) # read parameters param_th_cluster <- readClusterDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(param_th_cluster) # editing edit_param_pollutants <- list_pollutants_values(multi_values = 0.3)[1:3]  editCluster(area = "fr",              cluster_name = "test_pollutant",             unitcount = 2L,              list_pollutants = edit_param_pollutants)  # read parameters param_th_cluster <- readClusterDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(param_th_cluster)

title: Antares new features v8.6.0
text: Antares version 8.6.0 provides new file mingen.txt, file must respect conditions. first condition respect dimension file mod.txt. second one consistency data 3 files (mingen.txt, mod.txt, maxpower_{area}.txt). Full documentation available function writeInputTS(). see information values checks. Values checks : Checks depends values parameters hydro.ini file.   creating study, .txt files containing time series empty. describe steps edit mingen.txt. Initial values : Steps create mingen file : Now can read time series.
code: # see hydro parameters  path_file_hydro <- file.path("input", "hydro", "hydro.ini") hydro_ini_values <- readIni(pathIni = path_file_hydro) hydro_params <- c('follow load', 'use heuristic', "reservoir") hydro_ini_values[hydro_params] #> $`follow load` #> $`follow load`$fr #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $`follow load`$it #> [1] TRUE #>  #>  #> $`use heuristic` #> $`use heuristic`$fr #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $`use heuristic`$it #> [1] TRUE #>  #>  #> $reservoir #> $reservoir$fr #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $reservoir$it #> [1] FALSE # Initialize mingen data (time series) mingen_data = matrix(0.06,8760,5)  # 1 - edit mod file (time series) mod_data = matrix(6,365,5) suppressWarnings(   writeInputTS(area = "fr", type = "hydroSTOR",               data = mod_data,               overwrite = TRUE) ) #> Importing mingen #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% #> Importing hydroStorage #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% # 2 - edit maxpower  maxpower_data <- matrix(6,365,4) suppressWarnings(   writeHydroValues(area = "fr",                   type = "maxpower",                   data = maxpower_data) ) #> x being coerced from class: matrix to data.table #> Importing mingen #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% #> Importing hydroStorageMaxPower #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% # 3 - edit mingen suppressWarnings(   writeInputTS(area = "fr", type = "mingen",               data = mingen_data,               overwrite = TRUE) ) #> Importing mingen #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% #> Importing hydroStorage #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% #> Importing mingen #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% #> Importing hydroStorageMaxPower #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% # read input time series read_ts_file <- readInputTS(mingen = "all") #> Importing mingen #>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |===================================                                   |  50%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% rmarkdown::paged_table(head(read_ts_file))

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: Short Term Storages : Parameter group now dynamic restriction user

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: Antares Simulator, format version now “9.2”. packages, make adjustment keep “920”. Check version current study :
code: dir_path <- tempdir() suppressWarnings(   createStudy(path = dir_path,              study_name = "test920",              antares_version = "9.2") ) current_study_opts <- simOptions() current_study_opts$antaresVersion #> [1] 920

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: just need create areas create st-storages.
code: createArea(name = "fr") createArea(name = "it")

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: can create new clusters, st-storage (v8.6), function createClusterST(). can see function documentation ?createClusterST. default can call function two parameters (area, cluster_name). Clusters created default properties time series.

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: Default group still “Other1” now can create/edit group name (version study >= 9.2).
code: # creation createClusterST(area = "fr",                  cluster_name = "test_storage",                  group = "my_own_group")  createClusterST(area = "it",                  cluster_name = "test_storage",                  group = "my_own_group_again")  # edit group of existing st-storage cluster editClusterST(area = "fr",                cluster_name = "test_storage",                group = "my_own_group_Pondage")  # read cluster properties tab <- readClusterSTDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(tab)

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: can create edit new clusters new properties (see doc ?createClusterST).
code: # new properties (default values) rmarkdown::paged_table(as.data.frame(storage_values_default(), check.names = FALSE)) # creation my_parameters <- storage_values_default() my_parameters$efficiencywithdrawal <- 0.5 my_parameters$`penalize-variation-injection` <- TRUE my_parameters$`penalize-variation-withdrawal` <- TRUE  createClusterST(area = "fr",                  cluster_name = "test_storage",                  group = "new_properties",                  storage_parameters = my_parameters,                  overwrite = TRUE)  createClusterST(area = "it",                  cluster_name = "test_storage",                  group = "new_properties",                  storage_parameters = my_parameters,                 overwrite = TRUE)  # read cluster properties  tab <- readClusterSTDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(tab) # edit properties of existing st-storage cluster my_parameters$efficiencywithdrawal <- 0.9 my_parameters$`penalize-variation-injection` <- FALSE my_parameters$`penalize-variation-withdrawal` <- FALSE  editClusterST(area = "fr",                cluster_name = "test_storage",               storage_parameters = my_parameters)  # read cluster properties  tab <- readClusterSTDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(tab)

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: five new .txt files containing one series dimension N=8760,P=1{N=8760, P=1} : cost-injection.txt cost-withdrawal.txt cost-level.txt cost-variation-injection.txt cost-variation-withdrawal.txt
code: # creation ratio_value <- matrix(0.7, 8760)    # default properties with new optional TS createClusterST(area = "fr",                  cluster_name = "good_ts_value",                  cost_injection = ratio_value,                  cost_withdrawal = ratio_value,                  cost_level = ratio_value,                  cost_variation_injection = ratio_value,                 cost_variation_withdrawal = ratio_value)  # read cluster TS values  tab <- readInputTS(st_storage = "all",                     showProgress = FALSE) rmarkdown::paged_table(head(tab)) # edit TS values of existing st-storage cluster new_ratio_value <- matrix(0.85, 8760)  # edit everything or anyone you want  editClusterST(area = "fr",               cluster_name = "good_ts_value",               cost_injection = new_ratio_value,                cost_withdrawal = new_ratio_value) #> Warning: No edition for 'list.ini' file  # read cluster TS values  tab <- readInputTS(st_storage = "all",                     showProgress = FALSE) rmarkdown::paged_table(head(tab))

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: Nothing changed remove clusters.
code: # read cluster names levels(readClusterSTDesc()$cluster) #> [1] "fr_good_ts_value" "fr_test_storage"  "it_test_storage"  # remove a cluster removeClusterST(area = "fr",                  cluster_name = "good_ts_value")  # read cluster  tab <- readClusterSTDesc() rmarkdown::paged_table(tab)

title: Antares new features v9.2
text: “generaldata.ini” settings file (settings/generaldata.ini) contains several sections. Antares Simulator v9.2 deletes parameters: adequacy patch/enable-first-step adequacy patch/set--null-ntc--physical---first-step preferences/initial-reservoir-levels message displayed parameters set NULL [adequacy patch] section. [preferences] section, initial-reservoir-levels parameter explicitly used dedicated function.
code: # user messages updateAdequacySettings(     set_to_null_ntc_between_physical_out_for_first_step = FALSE) #> Warning: The `set_to_null_ntc_between_physical_out_for_first_step` argument of #> `updateAdequacySettings()` is deprecated as of antaresEditObject 2.9.2. #> ℹ This parameter are no longer supported for an Antares version >= '9.2', the #>   values will be ignored. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. updateAdequacySettings(enable_first_step = FALSE) #> Warning: The `enable_first_step` argument of `updateAdequacySettings()` is deprecated as #> of antaresEditObject 2.9.2. #> ℹ This parameter are no longer supported for an Antares version >= '9.2', the #>   values will be ignored. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

title: User guide
text: First ’s necessary load package: need set path Antares study “input” mode: can simply create new study:
code: # CRAN limite CPU usage data.table::setDTthreads(2) library(antaresEditObject) antaresRead::setSimulationPath(path = "path/to/study", simulation = "input") createStudy("path/to/study")

title: User guide
text: modifying study, can save archive: create .tar.gz file study folder.
code: backupStudy(what = "input")

title: User guide
text: can create new area : can specify localization area map, also color. two helper functions area parameters: filteringOptions() filtering options, like filter-year--year nodalOptimizationOptions() nodal optimizations options.
code: createArea(name = "myarea")  # The new area should appear here: antaresRead::getAreas()

title: User guide
text: can initialize cluster parameters: can also edit settings existing cluster:
code: createCluster(   area = "myarea",    cluster_name = "myareacluster",   group = "other",   unitcount = 1,   nominalcapacity = 8400,   `min-down-time` = 0,   `marginal-cost` = 0.010000,   `market-bid-cost` = 0.010000 ) editCluster(   area = "myarea",    cluster_name = "myareacluster",    nominalcapacity = 10600.000 )

title: User guide
text: can edit settings existing link:
code: createLink(   from = "area1",    to = "area2",    propertiesLink = propertiesLinkOptions(     hurdles_cost = FALSE,     transmission_capacities = "enabled"   ),    dataLink = NULL ) editLink(   from = "area1",   to = "area2",   transmission_capacities = "infinite" )

title: User guide
code: createBindingConstraint(   name = "myconstraint",    values = matrix(data = c(rep(c(19200, 0, 0), each = 366)), ncol = 3),    enabled = FALSE,    timeStep = "daily",   operator = "both",   coefficients = c("fr%myarea" = 1) )

what: Create several Pumped Storage Power plant (PSP)
title: User guide
code: pspData <- data.frame(   area = c("a", "b"),    installedCapacity = c(800,900) )  createPSP(   areasAndCapacities = pspData,    efficiency = 0.75 )

title: User guide
code: dsrData <- data.frame(   area = c("a", "b"),   unit = c(10,20),    nominalCapacity = c(100, 120),   marginalCost = c(52, 65),   hour = c(3, 7) )    createDSR(dsrData)

title: User guide
text: example, set output simulation year year, limit number Monte-Carlo years 10:
code: updateGeneralSettings(year.by.year = TRUE, nbyears = 10)

title: User guide
text: can remove areas, links, clusters binding constraints input folder remove* functions, e.g.:
code: removeArea("myarea")

title: User guide
text: First, update general settings activate time series generate: run TS-generator:
code: updateGeneralSettings(generate = "thermal") runTsGenerator(   path_solver = "C:/path/to/antares-solver.exe",    show_output_on_console = TRUE )

title: User guide
text: Launch Antares simulation R:
code: runSimulation(   name = "myAwesomeSimulation",    mode = "economy",   path_solver = "C:/path/to/antares-solver.exe",    show_output_on_console = TRUE )

what: Read a time series, update it and write it
title: User guide
text: update existing time series write , can use following commands :
code: # Filepath of the study, version >= 820 my_study <- file.path("", "", "") opts <- setSimulationPath(my_study, simulation ="input") opts$timeIdMax <- 8760  # Links, use only one link my_link <- as.character(getLinks()[1]) ts_input <- readInputTS(linkCapacity = my_link, opts = opts)  # Sort the data to ensure its reliability data.table::setorder(ts_input, cols = "tsId", "timeId")   # Reshape to wide format : writeInputTS expects a 8760 * N matrix  metrics <- c("transCapacityDirect", "transCapacityIndirect") ts_input_reformatted <- data.table::dcast(ts_input,                                           timeId ~ tsId,                                           value.var = metrics                                           ) # Add a value my_param to your matrix my_param <- 123 writeInputTS(data = ts_input_reformatted[,2:ncol(ts_input_reformatted)] + my_param,              type = "tsLink",              link = my_link,              overwrite = TRUE,              opts = opts              )   # Thermal, use only one area and one cluster my_area <- "zone" my_cluster <- "mon_cluster" ts_input <- readInputTS(thermalAvailabilities = my_area, opts = opts) ts_input <- ts_input[cluster == paste0(my_area,"_",my_cluster)]  # Sort the data to ensure its reliability data.table::setorder(ts_input, cols = "tsId", "timeId")  # Reshape to wide format : writeInputTS expects a 8760 * N matrix  metrics <- c("ThermalAvailabilities") ts_input_reformatted <- data.table::dcast(ts_input,                                           timeId ~ tsId,                                           value.var = metrics                                           )  # Add a value my_param to your matrix my_param <- 1000 editCluster(area = my_area,             cluster_name = my_cluster,             time_series = ts_input_reformatted[,2:ncol(ts_input_reformatted)] + my_param,             opts = opts             )   # Run of River, use only one area my_area <- "zone" ts_input <- readInputTS(ror = my_area, opts = opts)  # Sort the data to ensure its reliability data.table::setorder(ts_input, cols = "tsId", "timeId")  # Reshape to wide format : writeInputTS expects a 8760 * N matrix  metrics <- c("ror") ts_input_reformatted <- data.table::dcast(ts_input,                                           timeId ~ tsId,                                           value.var = metrics )  # Add a value my_param to your matrix my_param <- 1000 writeInputTS(area = my_area,             type = "hydroROR",             data = ts_input_reformatted[,2:ncol(ts_input_reformatted)] + my_param,             overwrite = TRUE,             opts = opts )

title: User guide
code: # set the path to an Antares study my_study <- file.path("", "", "") opts <- setSimulationPath(my_study, simulation ="input")  # choose geographic trimming when creating new Antares areas # default filtering : c("hourly","daily","weekly","monthly","annual") initial_filtering_synthesis <- c("weekly","monthly") initial_filtering_year_by_year <- c("monthly","annual")   opts <- createArea(name = "area1",                    filtering = filteringOptions(                      filter_synthesis = initial_filtering_synthesis,                      filter_year_by_year = initial_filtering_year_by_year),                    opts = opts) opts <- createArea(name = "area2",opts = opts) opts <- createLink(from = "area1",                     to = "area2",                     propertiesLink = propertiesLinkOptions(                      filter_synthesis = initial_filtering_synthesis,                      filter_year_by_year = initial_filtering_year_by_year),                    opts = opts)  # check the initial filters initial_GT <- getGeographicTrimming(areas="area1",links=TRUE,opts=opts) print(initial_GT$areas[["area1"]]) print(initial_GT$links[["area1 - area2"]])  # edit geographic trimming of an existing area or link new_filtering_synthesis <- c("monthly") new_filtering_year_by_year <- c("annual")  opts <- editArea(name = "area1",                   filtering = list(                    "filter_synthesis" = paste(new_filtering_synthesis,collapse = ", ")                    "filter_year_by_year" = paste(new_filtering_year_by_year,collapse = ", ")),                  opts = opts) opts <- editLink(from = "area1",                  to = "area2",                  filter_year_by_year = new_filtering_year_by_year,                  filter_synthesis = new_filtering_synthesis,                  opts = opts)   # check the new filters new_GT <- antaresRead::getGeographicTrimming(areas="area1",links=TRUE,opts=opts) print(new_GT$areas[["area1"]]) print(new_GT$links[["area1 - area2"]])  # important : make sure that `geographic-trimming` parameter is activated in general settings opts <- updateGeneralSettings(geographic.trimming = TRUE,opts = opts)

title: Renewables Energy Sources
text: Like thermal clusters, ’s equivalent functions create, edit remove RES clusters: Edit existing cluster : remove cluster :
code: # create an area to create a cluster in it createArea(name = "area51")  # Create a renewable cluster createClusterRES(   area = "area51",    cluster_name = "ren01",    add_prefix = FALSE )  # Use an other group and some parameters createClusterRES(   area = "area51",    cluster_name = "ren02",    group = "Wind Offshore",   nominalcapacity = 123,   ts_interpretation = "production-factor",   add_prefix = FALSE ) editClusterRES(   area = "area51",    cluster_name = "ren02",    group = "Solar Rooftop", # new group   add_prefix = FALSE ) removeClusterRES(area = "area51", cluster_name = "ren01")

text: name name binding constraint. id id, default use name. values Values used constraint. contains one line per time step three columns "less", "greater" "equal" (see documentation using version study >= v8.7.0) enabled Logical, constraint enabled ? timeStep Time step constraint applies : hourly, daily weekly. operator Type constraint: equality, inequality one side sides. filter_year_by_year Marginal price granularity year year filter_synthesis Marginal price granularity synthesis coefficients named list containing coefficients used constraint, coefficients alphabetically ordered see examples entering weight weight offset. group "character" group constraint, default value : "default group" overwrite constraint already exist, overwrite previous value. opts List simulation parameters returned function antaresRead::setSimulationPath()

title: Create a binding constraint — createBindingConstraint
text: updated list containing various information simulation.

title: Create a binding constraint — createBindingConstraint
text: According Antares version, usage may vary : < v8.7.0 : constraint name, .txt file containing 3 time series "less", "greater", "equal" >= v8.7.0 : constraint name, one file .txt containing <id>_lt.txt, <id>_gt.txt, <id>_eq.txt Parameter values must named list ("lt", "gt", "eq") containing data.frame scenarized. see example section .

title: Create a binding constraint — createBindingConstraint
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # < v8.7.0 :  # Create constraints with multi coeffs (only weight)  createBindingConstraint(   name = "myconstraint",    values = matrix(data = rep(0, 8760 * 3), ncol = 3),    enabled = FALSE,    timeStep = "hourly",   operator = "both",   coefficients = list("area1%area2" = 1,     "area1%area3" = 2) )  # Create constraints with multi coeffs + offset  createBindingConstraint(   name = "myconstraint",    values = matrix(data = rep(0, 8760 * 3), ncol = 3),    enabled = FALSE,    timeStep = "hourly",   operator = "both",   coefficients = list("area1%area2" = "1%1",     "area1%area3" = "2%3") )   # >= v8.7.0 :  # values are now named list containing `data.frame` according to     # `operator` parameter (for "less", build a list with at least "lt" floor in list)   # data values (hourly) df <- matrix(data = rep(0, 8760 * 3), ncol = 3) values_data <- list(lt=df)   # create bc with minimum value createBindingConstraint(name = "bc_example",                          operator = "less",                          values = values_data,                          overwrite = TRUE)                          # or you can provide list data with all value values_data <- list(lt=df,                     gt= df,                     eq= df)                        createBindingConstraint(name = "bc_example",                          operator = "less",                          values = values_data,                          overwrite = TRUE)                                } # }

title: Create multiple binding constraint at once. — createBindingConstraintBulk
text: According Antares version, usage may vary : >= v8.7.0 : constraint name, one file .txt containing <id>_lt.txt, <id>_gt.txt, <id>_eq.txt. Parameter values must named list ("lt", "gt", "eq") containing data.frame scenarized. Add parameter group input list constraints see example section .

title: Create multiple binding constraint at once. — createBindingConstraintBulk
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # For Study version < v8.7.0 # Create multiple constraints  # Prepare data for constraints  bindings_constraints <- lapply(   X = seq_len(100),   FUN = function(i) {     # use arguments of createBindingConstraint()     # all arguments must be provided !     list(       name = paste0("constraints", i),        id = paste0("constraints", i),        values = matrix(data = rep(0, 8760 * 3), ncol = 3),        enabled = FALSE,        timeStep = "hourly",       operator = "both",       coefficients = list("area1%area2" = 1),       overwrite = TRUE     )   } ) # create all constraints createBindingConstraintBulk(bindings_constraints)  # For Study version >= v8.7.0 (add parameter `group`)  # data values (hourly) df <- matrix(data = rep(0, 8760 * 3), ncol = 3) values_data <- list(lt=df,                      gt= df)     # create multiple constraints bindings_constraints <- lapply(   X = seq_len(10),   FUN = function(i) {     # use arguments of createBindingConstraint()     # all arguments must be provided !     list(       name = paste0("constraints_bulk", i),        id = paste0("constraints_bulk", i),        values = values_data,        enabled = FALSE,        timeStep = "hourly",       operator = "both",       coefficients = list("at%fr" = 1),       group= "group_bulk",      overwrite = TRUE    )   } )   createBindingConstraintBulk(bindings_constraints)   } # }

Parameters write Ini file. Careful! parameters must set integers avoid warnings Antares, example, set unitcount, use unitcount = 1L. list_pollutants list named specific pollutants (Antares version >= 860) time_series "ready-made" 8760-hour time-series available simulation purposes. prepro_data Pre-process data, data.frame matrix, default matrix 365 rows 6 columns. prepro_modulation Pre-process modulation, data.frame matrix, specified, must 8760 rows 1 4 columns. add_prefix TRUE (default), cluster_name prefixed area name. overwrite Logical, overwrite cluster . opts List simulation parameters returned function antaresRead::setSimulationPath()

title: Create a cluster — createCluster
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  library(antaresRead) library(antaresEditObject)  # Create a cluster : createCluster(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster",   group = "other",    unitcount = 1L, # or as.integer(1)   marginal_cost = 50 ) # by default, cluster name is prefixed  # by the area name levels(readClusterDesc()$cluster) # > "fr_my_cluster"  # To prevent this, use `add_prefix` createCluster(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster",   add_prefix = FALSE,   group = "other",    marginal_cost = 50 ) levels(readClusterDesc()$cluster) # > "my_cluster"   # Create a RES cluster : createClusterRES(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster_res",   group = "other",    unitcount = 1L, # or as.integer(1)   nominalcapacity = 50,   ts_interpretation = "power-generation" )   # You can also specify that the Time-Series of the RES cluster are # production factors : createClusterRES(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster_res",   group = "other",    unitcount = 1L, # or as.integer(1)   nominalcapacity = 50,   ts_interpretation = "production-factor" )   # Pre-process data :   # this is the default data : createCluster(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster",   prepro_data = matrix(     data = c(rep(1, times = 365 * 2),              rep(0, times = 365 * 4)),      ncol = 6   ) )  # with a data.frame createCluster(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster",   prepro_data = data.frame(     v1 = rep(7, 365), # column name does not matter     v2 = rep(27, 365),     v3 = rep(0.05, 365),     v4 = rep(0.12, 365),     v5 = rep(0, 365),     v6 = rep(1, 365)   ) )   # Pre-process modulation :  # this is the default data createCluster(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster",   prepro_modulation = matrix(     data = c(rep(1, times = 365 * 24 * 3),              rep(0, times = 365 * 24 * 1)),     ncol = 4   ) )  # with a data.frame createCluster(   area = "fr",    cluster_name = "my_cluster",   prepro_modulation = data.frame(     var1 = rep(0, 8760), # column name does not matter     var2 = rep(1, 8760),     var3 = rep(0, 8760),     var4 = rep(1, 8760)   ) )  } # }

PMAX_injection Modulation charging capacity 8760-hour basis. numeric {0;1} (8760*1). PMAX_withdrawal Modulation discharging capacity 8760-hour basis. numeric {0;1} (8760*1). inflows Algebraic deviation state charge storage, induce power generation consumption system numeric {<0;>0} (8760*1). lower_rule_curve lower limit filling stock imposed hour. numeric {0;1} (8760*1). upper_rule_curve upper limit filling stock imposed hour. numeric {0;1} (8760*1). cost_injection Penalizes injection flowrate hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). cost_withdrawal Penalizes withdrawal flowrate hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). cost_level Penalizes volume stored energy hour (€/MWh) numeric {<0;>0} (8760*1). cost_variation_injection Penalizes injection flowrate variation every hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). cost_variation_withdrawal Penalizes withdrawal variation every hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). add_prefix TRUE (default), cluster_name prefixed area name. overwrite logical, overwrite cluster . opts List simulation parameters returned function antaresRead::setSimulationPath()

title: Create a short-term storage cluster — createClusterST
text: write parameters list.ini file. function storage_values_default() called default. function return list containing properties according study version cluster st-storage. Study version >= "8.6.0" : efficiency = 1  (numeric {0;1}) reservoircapacity = 0  (integer >= 0) initiallevel = 0  (numeric {0;1}) withdrawalnominalcapacity = 0  (integer >= 0) injectionnominalcapacity = 0  (integer >= 0) initialleveloptim = FALSE (logical TRUE/FALSE) Study version >= "8.8.0" (update + new parameter) : initiallevel = 0.5  (numeric {0;1}) enabled = TRUE (logical TRUE/FALSE) Study version >= "9.2" (new parameters) : efficiencywithdrawal = 1 (numeric {0;1}) penalize-variation-injection = FALSE (logical TRUE/FALSE) penalize-variation-withdrawal = FALSE logical TRUE/FALSE) default, values allow active cluster (See example section.)

title: Create a short-term storage cluster — createClusterST
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # list for cluster parameters :  storage_values_default()  # create a cluster by default (with default parameters values + default data values): createClusterST(area = "my_area",                 "my_cluster")     # Read cluster in study                              # by default, cluster name is prefixed   # by the area name levels(readClusterSTDesc()$cluster) # > "my_area_my_cluster"  # create cluster with custom parameter and data   # use the function to create your own list of parameters (no Antares optim)   # if you want optim (my_parameters$initialleveloptim <- TRUE) my_parameters <- storage_values_default() my_parameters$efficiency <- 0.5 my_parameters$initiallevel <- 10 my_parameters$withdrawalnominalcapacity <- 100 my_parameters$injectionnominalcapacity <- 1000 my_parameters$reservoircapacity <- 10000    # time series  inflow_data <- matrix(3, 8760) ratio_data <- matrix(0.7, 8760)  createClusterST(area = "my_area",                  "my_cluster",                 storage_parameters = my_parameters,                 PMAX_withdrawal = ratio_data,                  inflows = inflow_data,                  PMAX_injection = ratio_data,                  lower_rule_curve = ratio_data,                  upper_rule_curve = ratio_data)                  # for a study version >= 9.2 (new parameters) my_parameters <- storage_values_default() my_parameters$efficiencywithdrawal <- 0.5 my_parameters$`penalize-variation-injection` <- TRUE my_parameters$`penalize-variation-withdrawal` <- TRUE  createClusterST(area = "my_area",                  "my_cluster",                 storage_parameters = my_parameters)                   # time series                   ratio_value <- matrix(0.7, 8760)  # default properties with new optional TS createClusterST(area = "fr",                  cluster_name = "good_ts_value",                  cost_injection = ratio_value,                  cost_withdrawal = ratio_value,                  cost_level = ratio_value,                  cost_variation_injection = ratio_value,                 cost_variation_withdrawal = ratio_value)                } # }

title: Create a link between two areas — createLink
text: eight potential times-series : NTC direct : upstream--downstream capacity, MW. Default 1. NTC indirect : downstream--upstream capacity, MW. Default 1. Hurdle cost direct : upstream--downstream transmission fee, euro/MWh. Default 0. Hurdle cost indirect : downstream--upstream transmission fee, euro/MWh. Default 0. Impedances : virtual impedances used economy simulations give physical meaning raw outputs, binding constraints defined enforce Kirchhoff's laws. Default 0. Loop flow : amount power flowing circularly though grid "nodes" perfectly balanced (import export). Default 0. PST min : lower bound phase-shifting can reached PST installed link, . Default 0. PST max : upper bound phase-shifting can reached PST installed link, . Default 0. According Antares version, usage may vary : < v7.0.0 : 5 first columns used following order: NTC direct, NTC indirect, Impedances, Hurdle cost direct, Hurdle cost indirect. >= v7.0.0 : 8 columns order expected. >= v8.2.0 : 2 cases : 8 columns provided: 2 first used tsLink, 6 used link data 6 columns provided: must provide NTC data tsLink argument.

PMAX_withdrawal Modulation discharging capacity 8760-hour basis. numeric {0;1} (8760*1). inflows Algebraic deviation state charge storage, induce power generation consumption system numeric {<0;>0} (8760*1). lower_rule_curve lower limit filling stock imposed hour. numeric {0;1} (8760*1). upper_rule_curve upper limit filling stock imposed hour. numeric {0;1} (8760*1). cost_injection Penalizes injection flowrate hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). cost_withdrawal Penalizes withdrawal flowrate hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). cost_level Penalizes volume stored energy hour (€/MWh) numeric {<0;>0} (8760*1). cost_variation_injection Penalizes injection flowrate variation every hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). cost_variation_withdrawal Penalizes withdrawal variation every hour (€/MWh) numeric {>0} (8760*1). add_prefix TRUE (default), cluster_name prefixed area name. opts List simulation parameters returned function antaresRead::setSimulationPath()

title: Edit a short-term storage cluster — editClusterST
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # study version >= "8.6.0"  # edit an existing cluster (see doc approved groups) name_group <- "Pondage"  editClusterST(area = "areaname",                cluster_name = "clustername",                group = name_group)  # edit properties all_params <- storage_values_default() all_params[["efficiency"]] <- 0.9 all_params[["reservoircapacity"]] <- 1000 all_params[["initiallevel"]] <- 0.5 all_params[["withdrawalnominalcapacity"]] <- 250 all_params[["injectionnominalcapacity"]] <- 200 all_params[["initialleveloptim"]] <- TRUE  editClusterST(area = "areaname",                cluster_name = "clustername",                storage_parameters = all_params)  # edit time series inflow_data <- matrix(3, 8760) ratio_data <- matrix(0.7, 8760)  editClusterST(area = "areaname",                cluster_name = "clustername",               PMAX_withdrawal = ratio_data,                inflows = inflow_data,                PMAX_injection = ratio_data,                lower_rule_curve = ratio_data,                upper_rule_curve = ratio_data)  # study version >= "9.2" (new parameters and TS)  # edit group (dynamic) name_group <- "MyOwnGroup"  editClusterST(area = "areaname",                cluster_name = "clustername",                group = name_group)  # edit properties my_parameters <- storage_values_default() my_parameters$efficiencywithdrawal <- 0.5 my_parameters$`penalize-variation-injection` <- TRUE my_parameters$`penalize-variation-withdrawal` <- TRUE  editClusterST(area = "areaname",                cluster_name = "clustername",                storage_parameters = my_parameters)  # edit time series ratio_data <- matrix(0.7, 8760)  editClusterST(area = "areaname",                cluster_name = "clustername",               cost_injection = ratio_data,                cost_withdrawal = ratio_data,                cost_level = ratio_data,                cost_variation_injection = ratio_data,                cost_variation_withdrawal = ratio_data) } # }

title: Read, create, update & deduplicate scenario builder — scenario-builder
text: n_scenario Number scenario. n_mc Number Monte-Carlo years. areas Areas use scenario builder, NULL (default) areas Antares study used. areas_rand Areas use "rand". group_bc character Bindgind constraints's groups names use. group_bc_rand character Bindgind constraints use "rand". coef_hydro_levels Hydro levels coefficients. mode character "bc" edit binding constraints. opts List simulation parameters returned function antaresRead::setSimulationPath() ruleset Ruleset read. as_matrix TRUE (default) return matrix, else list. ldata matrix obtained scenarioBuilder, named list matrices obtained scenarioBuilder, names must 'l', 'h', 'w', 's', 't', 'r', 'ntc', 'hl' 'bc', depending series update. series Name(s) serie(s) update ldata single matrix. clusters_areas data.table two columns area cluster identify area/cluster couple update thermal renewable series. Default read clusters description update couples area/cluster. links Links use series "ntc". Either simple vector links described "area01%area02 data.table two columns . Default read existing links update .

title: Read, create, update & deduplicate scenario builder — scenario-builder
text: scenarioBuilder : matrix readScenarioBuilder : list matrix list according as_matrix parameters.

title: Read, create, update & deduplicate scenario builder — scenario-builder
text: series = "ntc" available Antares >= 8.2.0. series = "hl", value must 0 1. User must enable/disable custom-scenario property settings/generaldata.ini . series = "bc" available Antares >= 8.7.0. single matrix, value series can : h hydro hl hydrolevels l load ntc r renewables s solar t thermal w wind

title: Read, create, update & deduplicate scenario builder — scenario-builder
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  library(antaresRead) library(antaresEditObject)  # simulation path setSimulationPath(   path = "pat/to/simulation",   simulation = "input" )  # Create a scenario builder matrix sbuilder <- scenarioBuilder(   n_scenario = 51,   n_mc = 2040,   areas_rand = c("fr", "be") ) sbuilder[, 1:6] dim(sbuilder)  # Create a scenario builder matrix for hydro levels (use case 1) sbuilder <- scenarioBuilder(   n_mc = opts$parameters$general$nbyears,   areas = c("fr", "be"),   coef_hydro_levels = c(0.1, 0.9) )  # Create a scenario builder matrix for hydro levels (use case 2) sbuilder <- scenarioBuilder(   n_mc = opts$parameters$general$nbyears,   areas = c("fr", "be"),   coef_hydro_levels = c(runif(opts$parameters$general$nbyears)   , runif(opts$parameters$general$nbyears)   ) )  # Create a scenario builder matrix with   # bindings constraints groups (study version >= 8.7.0)   # Use parameter "mode" with "bc"    sbuilder <- scenarioBuilder(   n_scenario = 51,   n_mc = 2040,   group_bc = c("my_bc_1", "my_bc_2"),    group_bc_rand = "my_bc_2",   mode = "bc" )  # Read previous scenario builder # in a matrix format prev_sb <- readScenarioBuilder()   # Update scenario builder  # Single matrix for load serie updateScenarioBuilder(ldata = sbuilder, series = "load") # can be l instead of load  # equivalent as updateScenarioBuilder(ldata = list(l = sbuilder))  # for binding constraints (study version >= 8.7.0) updateScenarioBuilder(ldata = sbuilder, series = "bc")  # update several series  # same input sbuilder updateScenarioBuilder(   ldata = sbuilder,    series = c("load", "hydro", "solar") )  # List of matrix updateScenarioBuilder(ldata = list(   l = load_sb,   h = hydro_sb,   s = solar_sb ))  # Deduplicate scenario builder  deduplicateScenarioBuilder() } # }

title: Write Hydro Values — writeHydroValues
text: area area add values. type Type hydro file, can "waterValues", "reservoir", "maxpower", "inflowPattern" "creditmodulations". data data must specific dimension depending type file : waterValues: 365x101 numeric matrix: marginal values stored energy based date (365 days) reservoir level (101 round percentage values ranging 0% 100%). 3-column matrix 365x101 rows. latter case 3 columns must 'date', 'level' 'value' (order), rows must sorted : ascending day, ascending level. reservoir: 365x3 numeric matrix. columns contains respectively levels min, avg max. maxpower: 365x4 numeric matrix. inflowPattern: 365x1 numeric matrix. creditmodulations: 2x101 numeric matrix. overwrite Logical. Overwrite values file already exists. opts List simulation parameters returned function antaresRead::setSimulationPath().

Overwrite values file already exists. opts List simulation parameters returned function antaresRead::setSimulationPath().
